intro: Faroa wellmanii, commonly known as the Kauai faroa, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, broad ovate leaves, and showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
